unnormalised: **EV Charging Gets a Boost, Just in Time for Festive Season**
normalised: **Electric Vehicle Charging Gets a Boost, Just in Time for Festive Season**

unnormalised: Bangalore - Forget range anxiety! The EV charging scene is heating up, especially with Onam just around the corner and trips back to Kerala on everyone's mind.
normalised: Bangalore - Forget range anxiety! The Electric Vehicle charging scene is heating up, especially with Onam just around the corner and trips back to Kerala on everyone's mind.

unnormalised: Ola Electric announced a massive expansion of its hypercharger network, aiming for 10,000 charging points across India by next year. Thatâ€™s a lot of juice!
normalised: Ola Electric announced a massive expansion of its hypercharger network, aiming for ten thousand charging points across India by next year. That's a lot of juice!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Ather Energy is collaborating with local kirana stores in Chennai to set up convenient charging hubs. Grab a biryani while you wait!
normalised: Meanwhile, Ather Energy is collaborating with local kirana stores in Chennai to set up convenient charging hubs. Grab a biryani while you wait!

unnormalised: IIT Delhi researchers are also working on faster charging tech that could potentially charge your EV in under 30 minutes. Imagine!
normalised: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi researchers are also working on faster charging tech that could potentially charge your Electric Vehicle in under thirty minutes. Imagine!

unnormalised: Tata Power continues its aggressive rollout across highways connecting major cities like Mumbai and Delhi. Their charging points are popping up faster than you can say "electric vehicle revolution."
normalised: Tata Power continues its aggressive rollout across highways connecting major cities like Mumbai and Delhi. Their charging points are popping up faster than you can say "electric vehicle revolution."

unnormalised: MG Motor India is also playing its part, installing chargers at select dealerships and residential complexes. It's looking like owning an EV is about to become a whole lot easier. Some companies are even testing subscription plans for Rs. 2000 per month giving unlimited km of usage. The future is electric, folks!
normalised: M G Motor India is also playing its part, installing chargers at select dealerships and residential complexes. It's looking like owning an Electric Vehicle is about to become a whole lot easier. Some companies are even testing subscription plans for rupee two thousand per month giving unlimited kilometer of usage. The future is electric, folks!
